TopicTitle: I figured out how to autorun

Articles.Content: (Sorry this is poorly lit) That's a hammer and a pair of twig shears, holds down SHIFT + W nicely.
I find I like to just use little stacks of pennies - carefully stacking until key depresses and stays down, then walk away for coffee/food/tv

Cool idea! I also used a stack of coins before I figured a software solution:

I don't know if this works on platforms other than Linux, KSP has to run in windowed mode, and I haven't used this exploit since 0.23.5, but it's possible to keep running if KSP just gets a key_pressed, but no key_released (or however they are calle in Unity) event. This can be achieved by focusing another window while running. I personally have window focus follow my mouse cursor, so it is simply enough to move the cursor out of the KSP window. I'm not sure, but it sounds reasonable to me, that also switching the active window using the task bar might work.
